features here that you can use and
combine to actually compromise the
security of that channel so F the first
feature is that you do not only have to
use transparent mode that is used in
this setup but the chip also um supports
another Mode called API mode and in API
mode you can send API frames so not only
just the payload but the payload is
wrapped into a packet and you can
specify the destination address for
example so the destination address of
this chip or of the other chip as an
attacker on your own um otherwise in
transparent mode the destination address
is always taken by the chip itself and
the payload is added Itself by the
chip so you switch to API mode and then
you are able to send the packets you
would like to send you you are able to
craft your own packets instead to rely
on the chip to craft the packet there is
another feature and that is really
simple it's called broadcast and this
broadcast feature allows you which can
only be used in API mode to send one
packet out instead of brood forcing
through all the addresses to get
acknowledgements back from all
participants within the network so you
send with one of those chip here first
you switch to IPI mode then you you send
a broadcast out to the network you
receive acknowledgements back one from
the UAV one from the Telemetry box you
extract the senders addresses because
the address of the center is is inside
of that packet right the acknowledgement
packet you extract those addresses and
then you know the participants within
the network so you know who the UAV is
which addresses has and you know the
Telemetry box and then there is a third
feature that you can use to remotely
change the address of another chip and
that is called remote at command so with
the attackers chip in API mode you can
craft the frame that tells another chip
to actually change its destination
address so for all future communication
the chip will not send its traffic
anymore to the original address which
means Telemetry box to UAV and the other
way around but instead the UAV and the
Telemetry box will then send all traffic
to the attacker right um um with the
previously recorded um senders addresses
from the acknowledgements you can then
forward the communication between the
two participants in the network and you
effectively mounted a man in the middle
attack so that is essentially not a buck
it's a feature of the system because
those chips are used in mesh networks
and in mesh networks you need to be able
to switch the communication route
quickly because there could be
congestion on one channel right so so
you would like to switch the
